intro: Clidemia claussenii, commonly known as the Hawaiian false mallow, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, often hairy leaves and showy, pink or white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and is often found in rocky or coastal areas. Its flowers are clustered in inflorescences and attract various pollinators, including bees and butterflies. Clidemia claussenii plays a role in the ecological dynamics of its habitat, contributing to biodiversity and soil stability.
